page.title: 10OVER WYRESDALE: WILDLIFE
page.content: The fishing rights on the R.Wyre are possessed by the Grosvenor Estates and a private fishing society - The Wyresdale Anglers. The river, during the fishing season, holds both salmon and migratory trout, the numbers depending on the condition of the river. The Abbeystead Reservoir attracts numerous species of wild duck and goose during the winter months e.g.mallard, teal, widgeon and Canada goose. On the open farmland partridge, curlew and lapwing are among the more common nesting birds. There are numerous small mammals, particularly hare, rabbit and hedgehog. Numbers of rabbits appear to be increasing though so too do cases of myxomatosis. There are more grey squirrels than in the past but no red ones. Occasionally roe deer are sighted but these must live higher up the valley.
